revised_title: The Repelling Power of Water-Fowl Feathers and Plant Leaves
tldr: The author investigates the repelling power of water from the feathers of water-fowl and the leaves of plants, discovering that an air-plate formation on the surface is responsible for the repulsion. This phenomenon is also observed in various other leaves and water-fowl, and the author suggests that this principle could be applied to the development of waterproof clothing.
